definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: His remarks irritated me a little.
sentences.chinese: 他的話讓我有點兒惱火。

sentences.english: She is mad at her son for killing the brood hen.
sentences.chinese: 她因兒子宰了傳種的母雞而對他十分惱火。
當有人排隊加塞時我惱火。

sentences.english: It may seize up and spatter and generally be disagreeable.
sentences.chinese: 糖漿會結塊並且飛濺起來，這通常讓人惱火。

sentences.english: Lee hopes futilely to read aloud children but don'ts think of a wife, make the wife more angry.
sentences.chinese: 李白想念兒女卻不想念妻子，讓妻子更爲惱火。

sentences.english: If there is one thing that annoys me, it’s people who don’t keep their promises.
sentences.chinese: 如果有什麼使我惱火的話，那就是不遵守諾言的人。

sentences.english: I was he witched by an electrical outlet that screamed out to me to stick in my little finger.
sentences.chinese: 我被一個電插座迷住了，它朝我直叫，讓我很惱火。

sentences.english: That might sound like an irritatingly abstract or pious plea.
sentences.chinese: 這可能聽上去像是一個抽象或虔誠得讓人惱火的請求。

sentences.english: When he said I was a fool,I really burned.
sentences.chinese: 聽到他說我是個傻瓜，我真惱火了。

sentences.english: Father is annoyed that his daughter consorts with all kinds of strange people.
sentences.chinese: 明的人廝混在一起，父親很是惱火。

sentences.english: She was exasperated by the senseless delays.
sentences.chinese: 她被無謂的拖延弄得很惱火。

sentences.english: I got  frustrated by other people slowing me down by stopping to chat in the street.
sentences.chinese: 我對有人站在路上聊天而擋住了去路的事情很惱火。

sentences.english: Sometimes that makes you angry, but these were different.
sentences.chinese: 這種情況有時確實令人惱火，但這次的情況不同。

sentences.english: "What are you doing here?" I ask, annoyed at the interruption.
sentences.chinese: “你在這兒做什麼？”我問，很惱火他打斷我。

sentences.english: The sigh infuriated the man and in a fit of rage he threw a stone at the mouse.
sentences.chinese: 他非常惱火，盛怒之下，他拿了塊石頭砸向老鼠。

definition: to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
